conclusion: The graph shows displacement x as a function of time t.
The slope of the tangent to the curve gives the instantaneous velocity.
Speed is the magnitude of velocity.
We need to find points where the magnitude of velocity is 5 m/s.
The slope of the tangent is the derivative of x with respect to t, representing velocity v(t).
Look for points where the tangent line has a slope of 5 or -5.
At t = 0, the slope is negative and steep.
As t increases, the slope decreases in magnitude.
At t = 2, the slope is zero (the curve is horizontal).
After t = 2, the slope becomes positive and increases.
Identify points where the tangent line has a slope of 5 or -5.
There are two points where the slope of the tangent is Â±5.
There are two moments when the speed is 5 m/s.
